name: 1-(2-nitro),2-dibenzoyl-1-tert-butylhydrazine

The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group introduces a significant increase due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular weight. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50 degrees Celsius. The tert-butyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The dibenzoyl group introduces two additional phenyl rings, which would significantly increase the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity.
